field.name: numOfLinksToDisplay
field.label: Number of listings under top level cats.
field.description: The number of listings to be shown under each top level categories

field.name: displaySearch
field.label: Show search bar
field.description: A search bar is typically displayed near the top of an Index page to allow your users to quickly search for the listings or categories they are looking for. Setting this to 'No' will disable search bar.

field.name: displayBrowseBy
field.label: Show 'Browse By'
field.description: Setting this to Yes, will let you user to browse by tags in Index view. The type of tags that shows here can be configured in Configuration.

field.name: displayIndexCatCount
field.label: Show categories count
field.description: Setting this to Yes, will show the total number of categories besides all top level categories in index.

field.name: displayIndexListingCount
field.label: Show listings count
field.description: Setting this to 'Yes' will show the total number of listings besides all top level categories in index.

field.name: displayCatDesc
field.label: Show category's description
field.description: Setting this to 'Yes' will show each categories' description underneath their header in Index page.

field.name: displayAlphaIndex
field.label: Show Alpha Index
field.description: Alpba Index shows a list of alphabets on top of the Index page to provide quick access to listings and categories that starts with a specific alphabet.

field.name: displayIndexCatImage
field.label: Show Categories' images
field.description: Setting this to 'Yes' will show top level categories' images (when available) beside their name.

field.name: showThumbnailSliderInDetailsView
field.label: Show Thumbnail Slider
field.description: By default, when there are 2 or more images in a listing, a thumbnail slider will be show. Set this to 'No' to disable this.

field.name: skipFirstImage
field.label: Skip the first image
field.description: By default, the first ordered image is used as the thumbnail and main graphical representative of a listing. Setting this option to 'Yes', will skip this first image and show second image and onwards in listing details page.

field.name: numOfColumnsInDetailsView
field.label: Custom field columns
field.description: The number of columns used to display custom fields' data in details view.

field.name: mainAttributeFieldsInDetailsView
field.label: Main Attribute Fields
field.description: Some listing details styles (currently listing details style 9 only) are designed with a dedicated area to display one or more fields. These are typically important attributes of your listings. For example, in a real estate directory, you may want to choose 'Bathrooms' and 'Beds' as your Main Attribute Fields. Make sure that the selected fields here are published and have been marked to show in details view.

field.name: numOfListingColumnsInSummaryView
field.label: Number of columns
field.description: The number of columns used to display listing summaries. Please note that not all listing summary styles supports displaying listing summaries in columns.

field.name: useImageSliderInSummaryView
field.label: Use Image Slider
field.description: Using image slider allows your users to view all images form a listing by clicking on the Previous/Next arrow in your listing thumbnails.

field.name: focusField1
field.label: Focus Field 1
field.description: Some listing summary styles are designed with a dedicated area to focus a field by surrounding them with key lines or highlight them with bold text. For example, in a real estate directory, you may want to choose 'Price' as the focus field; or in a web directory, you can choose 'Website'.

field.name: focusField2
field.label: Focus Field 2
field.description: This is similar to Focus Field 1. Some listing summary styles are designed with a dedicated area to focus two or more fields by surrounding them with key lines or highlight them with bold text.

field.name: mainAttributeFields
field.label: Main Attribute Fields
field.description: Some listing summary styles (currently listing summary style 1, 2, 5, 6, 7 and 8 only) are designed with a dedicated area to display one or more fields. These are typically important attributes of your listings. For example, in a real estate directory, you may want to choose 'Bathrooms' and 'Beds' as your Main Attribute Fields. Make sure that the selected fields here are published and have been marked to show in summary view.

field.name: useFeaturedHighlight
field.label: Highlight featured listing
field.description: Using highlight will display a border and a different background color to a featured listing in summary view.

field.name: numOfColumnsInSummaryView
field.label: Custom field columns
field.description: The number of columns used to display custom fields' data in summary view.

field.name: showActionLinksInSummary
field.label: Show action links
field.description: Setting this to 'Yes' will show action links in summary view. eg: Submit Review, Recommend, Print, Contact Owner, Visit, Report, Owner's Listing & Map.

field.name: showImageInSummary
field.label: Show image
field.description: Setting this to 'Yes', will show the listing's first image in summary view.

field.name: listingSummaryImageHeight
field.label: Image Height
field.description: Often, uploaded images on listings have different dimension. This parameter allows you to specify a fixed height for images that are shown in summary view. Specify the height in pixels (px). Enter the numeric value without the 'px' unit. eg: 180

field.name: showFillerImage
field.label: Show filler images
field.description: When set to 'Yes', filler image is shown in summary view when there are no images uploaded to listings.

field.name: onlyShowRootLevelCatInListalpha
field.label: Only show root level category in listalpha
field.description: If you have a large number of categories, turning on this feature will decrease the number of categories shown in listalpha by only showing root level categories.

field.name: displayAddressInOneRow
field.label: Show address related fields in one row
field.description: In order for this feature to work properly, you need to publish the 'Address' field.
